p: To this family belongs the genus Satureja L., which includes about 200 species of aromatic plants that contain >0.5% of essential oil,[ 16] its main constituents are carvacrol, thymol, phenols, and flavonoids,[ 17] responsible compounds of the in vitro antioxidant properties of Satureja hortensis, Satureja spicigera, Satureja cuneifolia, and Satureja cilicica.[ 18 19 20] Species from this genus have been used in traditional medicine as analgesic, tonic, or carminative for the treatment of gut disorders.[ 21]
